title: I promise this story about microwaves is interesting.
author: Tom Scott
description:
I found an article that said "The microwave was invented to heat hamsters humanely in 1950s experiments." And I thought, no it wasn't. ...was it?

Pull down the description for thorough references and credits.

Thanks to James Lovelock for his time! His latest book is Novacene: https://amzn.to/3hmKsWz [that is, of course, an Amazon affiliate link]
 
Filmed safely: https://www.tomscott.com/safe/ - thanks to jabs, PCR tests, isolation and distancing.

I did consider whether to do an extended interview with Dr Lovelock, but the Science Museum has already done far better than I ever could:

On cyborgs, asteroids and Gaia theory: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fg-3wBBpM_M

On his greatest epiphany: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lxYMl4ZBxBk

An extended 90-minute interview from the Lovelock Centenary Conference: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MGziItCwDJA

REFERENCES:

HISTORY OF THE MICROWAVE:
I Burrell, in the Independent, 1997: "Your money, or the cat gets microwaved": https://www.independent.co.uk/news/your-money-or-the-cat-gets-microwaved-1246775.html
M Blitz, "The Amazing True Story of How the Microwave Was Invented by Accident": https://www.popularmechanics.com/technology/gadgets/a19567/how-the-microwave-was-invented-by-accident/
E Schliephake, "Ultra-short waves in medicine" in Short Wave Craft, Vol. 3, No. 11, March 1933, p. 646  [PDF]: https://worldradiohistory.com/Archive-Short-Wave-Television/30s/SW-TV-1933-03.pdf
E Ackerman, "A Brief History of the Microwave Oven", IEEE Spectrum: https://spectrum.ieee.org/tech-history/space-age/a-brief-history-of-the-microwave-oven

Radarange photo from Acroterion: https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:NS_Savannah_microwave_oven_MD8.jpg - image licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 3.0 Unported license, https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/deed.en

James Lovelock in 1962: Photo by Donald Uhrbrock/The LIFE Images Collection via Getty Images/Getty Images

PAPERS FROM NIMR:
A Smith, J Lovelock, A Parkes, 1954: Resuscitation of Hamsters after Supercooling or Partial Crystallization at Body Temperatures Below 0° C.. Nature 173, 1136–1137. https://doi.org/10.1038/1731136a0
R K Andjus, J E Lovelock, 1955: Reanimation of rats from body temperatures between 0 and 1° C by microwave diathermy. The Journal of Physiology, 128. https://doi.org10.1113/jphysiol.1955.sp005323. 
Lovelock, J E, Smith A U, 1959, Heat transfer from and to animals in experimental hypothermia and freezing. Annals of the New York Academy of Sciences, 80: 487-499. https://doi.org/10.1111/j.1749-6632.1959.tb49226.x

Hi! You pulled down the description, which means you've unlocked a secret: I'm testing out a weekly newsletter, to help get around The Algorithm. It goes out on Mondays, contains a link to that week's video, but it also has a load of other interesting things that I've found over the week. I'm not publicising it much right now because I'm still testing that everything works, but if you want to subscribe, you should go here: https://www.tomscott.com/newsletter/

I'm at https://tomscott.com
on Twitter at https://twitter.com/tomscott
on Facebook at https://facebook.com/tomscott
and on Instagram as tomscottgo

localize.description:
"電子レンジは1950年代の実験でハムスターを人道的に加熱するために発明された "という記事を見つけました。そして私は、それは違うと思いました。 ...そうだったの？

徹底した参考文献とクレジットについては、記述を引き下げてください。

James Lovelock氏に感謝します。彼の最新の著書はNovacene: https://amzn.to/3hmKsWz [これはもちろん、Amazonのアフィリエイトリンクです] です。
 
無事に撮影できました： https://www.tomscott.com/safe/ - ジャブ、PCR検査、隔離、距離を置くことに感謝します。

ラブロック博士に長時間のインタビューをするかどうか検討しましたが、科学博物館がすでに私よりもはるかに優れたインタビューを行っています。

サイボーグ、小惑星、ガイア理論について: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fg-3wBBpM_M

彼の最大の啓示について https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lxYMl4ZBxBk

ラブロック・センテナリー・カンファレンスでの90分のロングインタビュー： https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MGziItCwDJA

参考文献

HISTORY OF THE MICROPHONE:
I Burrell, in the Independent, 1997: "Your money, or the cat gets microwaved": https://www.independent.co.uk/news/your-money-or-the-cat-gets-microwaved-1246775.html
M Blitz, "The Amazing True Story of How the Microwave Was Invented by Accident": https://www.popularmechanics.com/technology/gadgets/a19567/how-the-microwave-was-invented-by-accident/
E Schliephake, "Ultra-short waves in medicine" in Short Wave Craft, Vol. 3, No. 11, March 1933, p. 646 [PDF]: https://worldradiohistory.com/Archive-Short-Wave-Television/30s/SW-TV-1933-03.pdf
E Ackerman, "A Brief History of the Microwave Oven", IEEE Spectrum: https://spectrum.ieee.org/tech-history/space-age/a-brief-history-of-the-microwave-oven

Radarange photo from Acroterion: https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:NS_Savannah_microwave_oven_MD8.jpg - image licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 3.0 Unported license, https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/deed.en

1962年、ジェームズ・ラブロック。Photo by Donald Uhrbrock/The LIFE Images Collection via Getty Images/Getty Images

NIMRの論文。
A Smith, J Lovelock, A Parkes, 1954: 体温が0°C以下で過冷却または部分的に結晶化した後のハムスターの蘇生。Nature 173, 1136-1137. https://doi.org/10.1038/1731136a0
R K Andjus, J E Lovelock, 1955: マイクロ波ジアテルミーによる0〜1°Cの体温からのラットの蘇生。The Journal of Physiology, 128. https://doi.org10.1113/jphysiol.1955.sp005323. 
Lovelock, J E, Smith A U, 1959, Heat transfer from and to animals in experimental hypothermia and freezing. Annals of the New York Academy of Sciences, 80: 487-499. https://doi.org/10.1111/j.1749-6632.1959.tb49226.x。

アルゴリズムを回避するために、私は週刊ニュースレターをテストしています。毎週月曜日に配信され、その週のビデオへのリンクが含まれていますが、それ以外にもその週に見つけた面白いことがたくさん書かれています。今はまだすべてが機能するかどうか試しているところなので、あまり公表していませんが、もし購読したいのであれば、こちらにアクセスしてください： https://www.tomscott.com/newsletter/

我发现一篇文章说 "微波炉的发明是为了在1950年代的实验中对仓鼠进行人性化的加热。" 我想，不，不是的。 ...是吗？

拉下描述，以了解彻底的参考资料和功劳。

感谢James Lovelock的时间! 他的新书是Novacene: https://amzn.to/3hmKsWz [当然，这是一个亚马逊的附属链接]
 
安全拍摄：https://www.tomscott.com/safe/ -- 感谢注射、PCR测试、隔离和疏通。

我确实考虑过是否要对洛夫洛克博士做一个延伸采访，但科学博物馆已经做得比我好得多。

关于机械人、小行星和盖亚理论：https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fg-3wBBpM_M

关于他最大的顿悟：https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lxYMl4ZBxBk

Lovelock百年纪念会议上的90分钟长篇采访：https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MGziItCwDJA

参考资料。

微波的历史。
I Burrell，在《独立报》，1997年："你的钱，或者猫被微波炉加热"：https://www.independent.co.uk/news/your-money-or-the-cat-gets-microwaved-1246775.html
M Blitz, "微波炉是如何意外发明的惊人真实故事": https://www.popularmechanics.com/technology/gadgets/a19567/how-the-microwave-was-invented-by-accident/
E Schliephake，"医学中的超短波"，载于《短波工艺》，第3卷，第11号，1933年3月，第646页[PDF]：https://worldradiohistory.com/Archive-Short-Wave-Television/30s/SW-TV-1933-03.pdf
E Ackerman，"微波炉的简史"，IEEE频谱：https://spectrum.ieee.org/tech-history/space-age/a-brief-history-of-the-microwave-oven

来自Acroterion的Radarange照片：https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:NS_Savannah_microwave_oven_MD8.jpg - 图片授权于知识共享署名-相同方式共享3.0不受限制许可，https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/deed.en

1962年的James Lovelock。照片：Donald Uhrbrock/The LIFE Images Collection via Getty Images/Getty Images

来自NIMR的论文。
A Smith, J Lovelock, A Parkes, 1954: 仓鼠在体温低于0°C时过冷或部分结晶后的复苏。自然173, 1136-1137。https://doi.org/10.1038/1731136a0
R K Andjus, J E Lovelock, 1955: 用微波透热法使体温在0和1摄氏度之间的大鼠恢复活力。生理学杂志》，128。https://doi.org10.1113/jphysiol.1955.sp005323。
Lovelock, J E, Smith A U, 1959, 实验性低温和冷冻中动物的热传递。纽约科学院年鉴》，80: 487-499。https://doi.org/10.1111/j.1749-6632.1959.tb49226.x
